relevant_findings.description: Physical examination revealed a well-developed, normally proportioned newborn in no distress. The phallus measured 1.5 cm, and there was a bifid scrotum with bilateral palpable gonads and a scrotal urethral meatus. No uterus or vagina was visualized.

other.definition: Insufficient rise of testosterone after hCG stimulation

relevant_findings.description: Hormone analysis showed elevated LH and insufficient rise of testosterone after hCG stimulation, along with elevated basal levels of 17-hydroxyprogesterone.

vital_signs.cortisol: Normal rise after ACTH stimulation (0.25 mg Synacthen iv)

relevant_findings.description: ACTH stimulation test showed a significant rise in 17-hydroxyprogesterone levels, while androstenedione and DHEA did not increase.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Methemoglobin level was only mildly elevated with no clinical signs of methemoglobinemia.
